alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 12:45PM MST until June 29 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 1244 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain across the warned area has decreased in intensity. However, between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen on the southern portions of the Crooks burn scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly as water drains. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the along Ash Creek/Mill Creek and into the Hassayampa River. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Yavapai County This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Ash Creek, Arrastra Creek, Middlewater Creek, Milk Creek, Pine Creek, Turkey Creek, Arrastre Creek, Blind Indian Creek, Towers Creek, Hassayampa River and Cellar Springs Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
